item.title: Incoming!
item.description: A “Missile Command” inspired arcade game, built in Unity.

item.title: Hex Grid Worlds
item.description: Repurposing hexagon grid board core logic from Hextopia with an aim to building the foundations of a new game.

item.title: Gun Turret
item.description: Borne of a desire to see if I could wrangle Unity’s then brand-new ECS library into some dramatic large-scale interactive battle scene I set out to see about building a gun turret.

item.title: Sheep Island
item.description: Sheep Island was a little project I made as a Christmas gift for a close friend. It’s the first self-generated project since I became a developer where I’ve actually managed to get to a point where I could call it “finished”!

item.title: Spider Bots
item.description: A silly hack-day inverse kinematics exploration that I kinda got carried away with.

item.title: Hextopia
item.description: Turn-based strategy game inspired by playing too much Polytopia and wondering “how hard could it be?”

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: In 2019 I had the good fortune to be able to use some company hack days to see about learning how various flavours of reinforcement learning work.

item.title: Road to Sheep Island
item.description: Building on my procedurally-generated island mesh, the next step was to see about bringing some life to the land.

item.title: Island Mesh
item.description: Building on Voronoi and Delaunay grids, I then sought to work out how to turn that into geometry in Unity.
